diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Partial Primary Deficiency of Insulin-Like Growth Factor (IGF)-I Activity Associated with IGF1 Mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient exhibited intrauterine growth restriction and progressive postnatal growth failure, normal hearing, microcephaly, and mild intellectual impairment. Key findings include markedly reduced concentrations of IGF-I with normal or elevated levels of IGFBP-3 and ALS. Genetic sequencing identified a homozygous missense IGF1 mutation (R36Q) which leads to reduced mitogenic activity and partial loss of binding to the receptor IGF-1R. The complexity of the patient's growth failure linked to IGF-I signaling was pivotal for the diagnosis.
